You can use the ardanaencrypt.py script to encrypt your IPMI passwords. This script uses OpenSSL.
Enter the encryption key into the following environment variable:

note.para: Before you run any playbooks, remember that you need to export the encryption key in the following environment variable: export ARDANA_USER_PASSWORD_ENCRYPT_KEY=<encryption key>

step.para: Commit your configuration to the local git repo (), as follows:
step.screen: &prompt.ardana;cd ~/openstack/ardana/ansible &prompt.ardana;git add -A &prompt.ardana;git commit -m "My config or other commit message"

important.para: This step needs to be repeated any time you make changes to your configuration files before you move on to the following steps. See for more information.

section.title: Installing &ostack; Assets on the Stand-alone Deployer
section.para: The &ostack; CLI and &ostack; clients will not be installed automatically. If you require access to these clients, you will need to follow the procedure below to add the appropriate software.

step.para: [OPTIONAL] To confirm that &ostack; clients have not been installed, connect to your stand-alone deployer and try to use the OpenStack CLI:
step.screen:
&prompt.ardana;source ~/keystone.osrc &prompt.ardana;openstack project list
-bash: openstack: command not found

step.para: Edit the configuration file containing details of your Control Plane, ~/openstack/my_cloud/definition/data/control_plane.yml
Locate the stanza for the cluster where you want to install the client(s). This will look like the following extract:
step.screen: clusters: - name: cluster0 cluster-prefix: c0 server-role: LIFECYCLE-MANAGER-ROLE member-count: 1 allocation-policy: strict service-components: - ntp-server - lifecycle-manager

step.para: Choose the client(s) you wish to install from the following list of available clients:
step.screen: - openstack-client - ceilometer-client - cinder-client - designate-client - glance-client - heat-client - ironic-client - keystone-client - neutron-client - nova-client - swift-client - monasca-client - barbican-client

step.para: Add the client(s) to the list of service-components - in the following example, several &ostack; clients are added to the stand-alone deployer:
step.screen: clusters: - name: cluster0 cluster-prefix: c0 server-role: LIFECYCLE-MANAGER-ROLE member-count: 1 allocation-policy: strict service-components: - ntp-server - lifecycle-manager - openstack-client - ceilometer-client - cinder-client - designate-client - glance-client - heat-client - ironic-client - keystone-client - neutron-client - nova-client - swift-client - monasca-client - barbican-client
&prompt.ardana;cd ~/openstack/ardana/ansible &prompt.ardana;git add -A &prompt.ardana;git commit -m "Add explicit client service deployment"

step.para: Run the configuration processor, followed by the ready-deployment playbook:
step.screen: &prompt.ardana;cd ~/openstack/ardana/ansible &prompt.ardana;ansible-playbook -i hosts/localhost config-processor-run.yml -e encrypt="" \ -e rekey="" &prompt.ardana;ansible-playbook -i hosts/localhost ready-deployment.yml
